author: Chester Dawson
title: Car Makers Get Their Wish on Fuel-Efficiency Standards
text:
The Trump administration’s move to ease fuel-efficiency standards is a boon to car executives who for years have said they couldn’t justify making smaller, less-profitable vehicles in an era when cheap gas made America’s appetite for pickups and SUVs insatiable.
Auto makers have long said Obama-era targets that exceed an industry-average fuel economy of 50 miles a gallon by 2025 were too steep for their bottom lines, even after various rules were put in place to help them along. Car companies, for example, were given credit...
